Chat

Interface ChatDisplay

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChatGui, Checkers.Board

    public interface ChatDisplay
    Interface defining the callback methods that must be supported for the socket threads to send data back to. In the default implementation, the ChatGui class implements this interface, and you do not need to write an implementing class of your own. If you change ChatSender or ChatReceiver to call new methods on the display object, they must be added to this interface. UNLESS YOU IMPLEMENT NEW FUNCTIONALITY, YOU DO NOT NEED TO EDIT THIS FILE. $Id: ChatDisplay.java
    Version:
    May 25, 2015
    Author:
    Jessica, Nanxi, Prachi, Period: 2, Assignment: CHECKERS, Sources: Simple Chat

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void chatMessage(SocketName name, java.lang.String message)
      Display a received chat message.
      void createSocket(SocketName name)
      Note the creation of a new socket and display it to the user.
      void destroySocket(SocketName name)
      Note the destruction of an existing socket and remove it from the user's display.
      void statusMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Displays a status message to the user.

    • Method Detail

      • statusMessage

        void statusMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a status message to the user. This could be in the main chat window, the console, or another area where the user can see it.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display

      • chatMessage

        void chatMessage(SocketName name,
               java.lang.String message)
        Display a received chat message. The socket where the message originated is provided in case you wish to display that information with the message.
        Parameters:
        name - The socket the message came from
        message - The chat message received

      • createSocket

        void createSocket(SocketName name)
        Note the creation of a new socket and display it to the user. This allows the user to see which sockets are currently connected and (possibly) disconnect them.
        Parameters:
        name - The socket that was just created

      • destroySocket

        void destroySocket(SocketName name)
        Note the destruction of an existing socket and remove it from the user's display.
        Parameters:
        name - The socket that was just destroyed
